name: sugar beet production | sugar beet | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15434/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of sugar beet. The average yield from 2009 - 2012 is 68.8 t/ha. The data are representative for sugar beet production in Germany used for the export market. Mineral NPK fertiliser input is 150-50-180 kg/ha. Organic fertilisers applied amount to 13 m3/ha of liquid manure and 9 t/ha of solid manure. Total active ingredients (a.i.) applied as pesticides amount to 6.96 kg a.i./ha.;The dataset was modelled within the project 'World Food LCA database (WFLDB)'. The aim of this project was to provide inventories of a broad variety of agricultural products and processes and to cover for each product at least 50% of the global export market. The share of sugar beet produced in Germany amounts to 10% of the global production (tonnage exported in 2010). The production system regarded in this dataset aimed at representing sugar beet produced in Germany for the export market.;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) = 1.2 (i.e. excellent quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends with the harvest of sugar beet at farm gate. The dataset includes all machine operations, corresponding infrastructure, fuel use and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, fertilisation, pesticide application, harvesting, and on-farm transport. Further, direct field emissions and land use change are included. Heavy metal uptake by the crop is considered. The inputs of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides as well as packaging of fertilisers and pesticides are considered. The dataset doesn't include emissions from manure storage because these are within the system boundary of animal production.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: If used, extrapolations are documented on the flow level.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Data sources: Data were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop and country;L3 = literature data or L1 resp. L2 data approved by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L4; Machinery: L4; Irrigation: L3. For information regarding the calculation of individual exchanges see supporting documentation WFLDB-Documentation.pdf.

Calculated value - 100% emission in soil. See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of sugar beet is calculated to be circa 1.01E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'cyclic N-compound', 'glyphosate', 'phenoxy-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.02E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'sugar beet' is calculated to be circa 5.53E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.11E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: This represent the transport of fertilizers that are directly linked to their supplying activities, to better represent the fertilizer mix of the activity. Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.
